sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  import { Playground, PropsTable } from 'docz'
import ProgressBar from './ProgressBar'

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"progressbar"}}>{`ProgressBar`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"base-usage"}}>{`Base usage`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The progress bar's width occupies all the space of it's parent.`}</MDXTag>
<Playground __position={0} __code={`<ProgressBar threshold={70} percentage={80}>
  Informative text: 80 of 100
</ProgressBar>
<ProgressBar threshold={70} percentage={20}>
  Informative text: 20 of 100
</ProgressBar>`} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,ProgressBar}}>
  <ProgressBar threshold={70} percentage={80}>
    Informative text: 80 of 100
  </ProgressBar>
  <ProgressBar threshold={70} percentage={20}>
    Informative text: 20 of 100
  </ProgressBar>
</Playground>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"props"}}>{`Props`}</MDXTag>
<PropsTable of={ProgressBar} />
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
